intro: Hoya palawanensis subsp. minor, commonly known as the Palawan Hoya, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its waxy, succulent leaves and clusters of star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a vine or shrub, often found in humid, shaded environments. Its flowers, which are usually white or pale pink, bloom in the summer months and attract pollinators such as moths and bees. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
